class_notes:
Course Description: 
Black education has been political, subversive, and contested from its inception in the United States.  This course will explore the ways in black educational institutions and educators created a model of educational excellence during segregation and prepared black students to participate in the black freedom struggle.  After exploring the curriculum and climate of black classrooms, we will consider the legacies of African American pedagogy for students today.
course_description:
African Americans created a model of educational excellence during de jure
segregated schools whose historical practices link with West Africa and whose implications extend to Finland. The class explores the components of this model and considers their implications for contemporary practice.
